Name: Douglas Drumond
AboutMe:
I'm an Android developer at Movile. I worked at Eldorado Research Institute also as Android developer and on low level stuff (Android platform, modem, C, C++, NDK and things like that), also a few months on iOS and I like both. I graduated in Computer Science, but I have a secret love for Applied Mathematics (I'm 85% major in Applied Math) and how to use both to solve problems. I had a small gap when I opened a startup on Business Intelligence, before coming back to Android.

I'm the founder and one of the organizers of Google Developer Group Campinas and I'm the current maintainer of MacVim.

I put my thoughts on Café Linear.

I practice karate, kendō, shodō, go and I'm learning Japanese language.
